cleaned_text: Guided Imagery and Meditation Resources Guided imagery uses spoken word to engage patients in active imagination and sensory exercises designed to produce a relaxation state. It can be delivered via audio recordings, such as found in the links below, or individualized with a practitioner. Guided imagery has been widely studied as a symptom management tool, and has been found to be useful for many people. It is safe and easy to use. There is good evidence for effectiveness in improving surgical outcomes and recovery, relaxation, anxiety, pain, cancer and cancer treatment-related symptoms, sleep, and addiction. We welcome your use of the following recordings for health promotion and personal empowerment. Please discuss any questions you may have with your healthcare providers or contact the Osher Center. If you are interested in an individualized guided imagery session, please contact the Osher Center Clinic to schedule at 415-353-7720. Guided Imagery and Meditation Audio Recordings Selected recordings for health promotion and personal empowerment are available for streaming.
